summary:
Programme Manager YEP: "Investments in young people are one of the most sustainable investments you can make, because you can 'harvest' this for a long time".

+++

Previously: Project Manager YEP Water, Secretary NGO Water Platform and Secretary International Division, Top Sector Water & Maritime. 

Globally too much, too little and too dirty water pose great challenges. The Netherlands Water Partnership (NWP) is convinced that by working together we can contribute to solving these problems. Nationally, but also internationally. Because water doesn’t stop at borders. Within the NWP network private companies, NGO’s, knowledge institutions and governmental organizations collaborate to achieve more impact abroad. The global water challenges offer opportunities for the Dutch water sector, that’s why NWP shares knowledge, organizes matchmaking and increases the sector’s visibility (conferences, missions, etc.). NWP is also co-executor of governmental programmes such as Partner for Water and YEP Programmes.

Do you also want more impact abroad? Send me an invitation to connect!

+++

Former policy officer for the Multilateral Organisations and Human Rights Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Kingdom of the Netherlands. As a member of the post-2015 team my focus was on the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), the post-2015 sustainable development agenda (Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)) and the Financing for Development (FfD) process of the United Nations. Previously I have gained working experience in the field of international relations and sustainable (inclusive) development as an intern at Oxfam Novib as an intern and as a volunteer for the Kumasi Institute of Tropical Agriculture in Ghana.

Education: BSc Human Geography (Utrecht University) and MSc Human Geography (University of Amsterdam). Master Thesis: ‘Inclusive Development’ and the Sustainable Development Goals.

Interests, inter alia: 
- Youth 
- Water, Agrofood, Renewable Energy
- Inclusive, international and sustainable development (Sustainable Development Goals)
- Geopolitics & Human rights
- Environmental issues
- Value chains
- United Nations
- Building with nature
- Biodiversity and ecology

education.field_of_study: Human Geography, Specialization: Sustainable Development, Environment and World Politics
Human Geography & Social Planning, specialization: Development and Urban studies

publications.name: Sustainable Development Goals and Inclusive Development
publications.publisher: United Nations University, Project on Sustainability Transformation Beyond 2015 (POST2015) and the Earth System Governance Project

authors.headline: Climate Action & Sustainable Development | Implementation & Finance | Gender Equality

profile_positions.description: Young Expert Programmes's (YEP Programmes) mission is to create a young, renewed, inspiring international network and build expertise in the field of Water, Agrofood and renewable Energy through Dutch organisations, operating in developing countries and emerging markets. Together we contribute to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager

profile_positions.description:
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Netherlands Water Partnership have initiated the Young Expert Programme Water (YEP Water) and the Young Expert Programme Agrofood (YEP Agrofood) -in partnership with the Food & Business Knowledge Platform- with the objective of providing assurances for the continued availability of international professionalism and expertise in the water and agri & business sector. Both programmes are carried out in YEP Programmes (www.yepprogrammes.com). 

YEP Programmes offers Dutch young professionals an opportunity to acquire professional experience abroad and young local professionals an opportunity to take their first steps in an international work environment via Dutch organisations. In adopting this approach YEP Programmes makes a contribution to a dynamic international water and agri & business network and makes this network open to a new generation of young experts.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager YEP Water at Netherlands Water Partnership

profile_positions.description:
Our world is facing considerable challenges that requires a continuous process of adaptation and innovation to future proof our planet, secure the wellbeing of current and future generations, and to facilitate sustainable economic development. Constantly changing market conditions require flexible and agile approaches.

The Netherlands has a strong reputation in water and maritime and we see it as one of our priorities to keep on innovating and connecting to other countries to jointly prepare for the future. 

We are committed to increase the visibility of the water sector and to maintain and strengthen relationships, guided by our mission: ‘Solving water challenges by increasing the world’s prosperity’.

Acting out of a common interest is key in creating a clear picture of opportunities for concrete cooperation, business, and circumstances to capitalize these opportunities.

By bringing parties together and clearly defining successes we will solve current and future problems in water and maritime.  

More information via:
- http://www.topsectorwater.nl/home/exportpromotie/
- http://www.topsectorwater.nl/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Topsector-Water-Maritiem-Internationaliseringstrategie-2017-2020.pdf
profile_positions.title: Secretary International Division, Top Sector Water & Maritime

profile_positions.description:
The participants of the NWP NGO Water Platform are committed to increase sustainable access to safe drinking water, sanitation, hygiene, water for economic development and 'wise use' of ecosystems in developing countries (WASH and IWRM). 

The NGO Platform represents the civil society organizations active in the water sector and facilitates the national and international dialogue on poverty reduction and water/sanitation. The platform promotes cooperation with the business community, governments, knowledge institutes and financial institutions.
profile_positions.title: Secretary NWP NGO Water Platform

profile_positions.description:
The Netherlands Water Partnership (NWP) is a comprehensive network of Dutch companies, NGOs, governmental organisations and knowledge institutes that unites Dutch water expertise. It aims to generate market and development opportunities for the Dutch water sector abroad. It acts as a centre of information on water expertise, policy developments and market opportunities.
 
I am working on (business) development in the water sector in the countries Ghana, Kenya and Rwanda in close cooperation with the Dutch embassies and the water sector parties.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer Water OS

profile_positions.description:
Policy Officer at the Multilateral Organisations and Human Rights Department – Social and Economic UN Affairs Division.
Responsible for: Millennium Development Goals, the Post-2015 sustainable development agenda and the financing for development process of the United Nations.
Mission as policy officer: Permanent Mission of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to the UN in New York.

Executing different tasks: Deputy Secretary, Commissioner for Education, Promotion & Planning Commissioner, head of the Education Committee, Promotion Committee, oikos Committee (association magazine) and Survival Committee.
